Reviews.Title: “Gets the job done”
Reviews.Author: justinbbfc
Reviews.Content: If you are arriving late from a Phoenix flight this is one of the few budget hotels that offers 24 hour shuttle service to the hotel. Nothing special to see at this hotel. The rooms were fairly clean and really this is just a place to spend a night. It is average in everything but i can't complain too much for how much we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place for an Overnighter.”
Reviews.Author: Pembroke54
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night as we had an early morning flight out of Phoenix. Appreciated the Shuttle Service, though it only runs on the hour which depending on your flight time can mean that you spend more time than you want to waiting at the airport. The Lodge itself was adequate, clean, the staff were friendly. The self serve breakfast was good and available from at least 3:45 onward. We found that the air conditioning unit in the room to be a bit noisy. Good size room, but no coffee maker. The tub and toilet are in a separate room from the washbasin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for an Over-nighter”
Reviews.Author: Andrea J
Reviews.Content: We arrived here from Yuma for one night so we could catch our morning flight home. We arrived late in the afternoon to a pleasantly clean and cozy room. Though not fancy the room was in good repair and tastefully presented with clean white towels and nice fresh beds. It was strangely comfortable beyond our expectations. The pool area was small but nice and had afternoon sun well into the evening which we enjoyed. The staff here are very accomodating and personable. The complimentary breakfast could be improved as it is limited to comercial style processed individually wrapped pastries and coffee which is not great for the health conscious. Fresh muffins with some milk and juices would have been preferred, along with some cold cereals even with an additional cost. The shuttle service to the airport was prompt and welcoming and best of all included in your stay. Though in somewhat of a light industrial area, we would stay again without hesitation. The staff and clean comfortable rooms were the strong point here.

Reviews.Title: “Not Mr. Roger's Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Mike C
Reviews.Content: Look, this place is a no-frills hotel in a pretty seedy neighborhood, there's no denying that. Now, with that out of the way, my experience here easily exceeded all expectations. The crew at the front desk were efficient and knew the city well, giving me exact directions which allowed me to meet my wife (she got lost) and make it to a Suns game in plenty of time. They have a shuttle to the airport, and even a sparse, but much better than nothing breakfast for those on the go, like me, who had an early morning fly out. Also, I was very surprised how clean our bathroom was, and that the room itself was not bad at all. Again, you won't think much of the nearby surroundings, but I would still recommend this place to someone looking to fly out of PHX. One more thing, even though you are not in the best location, security seemed sufficient at the hotel, and we felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great for flying in or out of Sky Harbor”
Reviews.Author: GweeVermont
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its easy-to-find location, proximity to the airport, free shuttle to and from the airport and car rental drop-off, and the value. We were checked in promptly, but we were given poor information about the shuttle to (and from) the airport. You have to sign up for it at check-in. Shuttle runs on the hour, beginning at 4 a.m. We had a 6:30 am flight out, and we took the shuttle at 4 because we understood we had to be at the airport two hours before flight time. We flew Southwest, and there were no clerks behind the counter until 5:30 a.m. - wish we had known, we would have slept another hour, and could have avoided standing for an hour in line to check bags. Also, the shuttle is not from the EconoLodge, but is through Airport Parking - a green and white shuttle bus that runs continuously outside Door 7 North, cross over to the pickup area for Hotels, just to the right after you cross the first lanes of traffic. We had a very long wait because the hotel clerk gave us the wrong name of the company to look for. The shuttle to the airport was on time. This hotel is located very close to the airport, although we heard no noise. Quiet room and very busy place - lots of airport travelers. The complimentary breakfast doesn't get set up until 4 a.m, so we didn't see it. The room was comfortable and clean, with older decor, but for a few hours sleep it was sufficient. There are a couple of restaurants nearby, and there were two delivery menus (Chinese and Italian) available in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and affordable”
Reviews.Author: SalandBrad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of it's proximity to the airport and the freeway, and affordability. Room was clean, staff helpful. Great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Airport stopover”
Reviews.Author: Spendingitnow
Reviews.Content: Clean comfortable bed. Some noise due to location and comings and goings. No hairdryer or coffee maker but had microwave. Good bath, Breakfast very limited but available from 4am. Front desk manned by a very harrassed but helpful Keith - owner should consider putting on additional staff to answer the phone at peak periods.

Reviews.Title: “Safe hotel even though it's in a shady neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: WendyPP
Reviews.Content: The neighborhood is less than desirable but the hotel was safe, clean and quiet. The mattresses are a little lumpy and the pillows are flat as a pancake, but I went to the front desk and they gave me an additional pillow so that helped. Free shuttle service to and from the airport was very prompt and the drivers are very friendly and helpful. The free breakfast consisted of danish, bagels, muffins, and assorted juice. If I were to go back to Phoenix and need to stay by the airport, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just for an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: yannaras
Reviews.Content: A cheap option when needing to be close to the aiport and that's it. The neighbourhood and surrounding area is not what I would like to see again...

Reviews.Title: “Good value,”
Reviews.Author: DannyGrrl
Reviews.Content: 2 couples stayed 3 separate times for a total of 5 nights in 2 weeks while touring Arizona. First stay was on arrival by air; second was on the way from Winslow to Tucson; third was just prior to flying out. All three times we were impressed with the staff. The rooms we stayed in were freshly painted and very clean, the beds were comfortable, and the wireless connection was speedy. The laundry facility was clean and well cared for, with good Maytag machines. Location is excellent; just minutes to Sky Harbor, with a 24 hour airport shuttle. It is close to a McD's for quick meals, and within walking distance of a Circle K for snacks and supplies, and the Knock-Kneed Lobster fish and chip shop around the corner has been a Phoenix fixture for 35 yrs. Neighborhood is a bit run down, but in 5 days over 2 weeks time we never felt unsafe or uncomfortable. Continental breakfast is typical, and now opens at 3:45 am to accomodate the 4 am shuttle to the airport. During our visit we watched them replace every bed in the motel with good solid Serta mattresses.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to spend a night”
Reviews.Author: Mustafa81
Reviews.Content: Spent the night at Econolodge, Phoenix enroute to Grand Canyon. The hotel is located couple of miles from Sky Harbor International Airport. Has a round the clock airport shuttle pickup arrangement. Our room was neat with a single queen bed. The bathroom was small but clean. Parking was available. The hotel offers complimentary breakfast from 4 AM but dont expect too much, may be coffee, banana and bagels. There are better eating options around with a Dennys and Mcd in walking distance. Value for money - thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Normal place to stay next to the airport”
Reviews.Author: maxim_mos
Reviews.Content: As we had a very early flight, we tried to find the place near to the airport. Econo Lodge is that place. Free WIFI, free breakfast starting at 4.00 am and a very reasonable price. Clean and big rooms, parking next to the door. So, nothing wrong about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Most Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: zeegirl116
Reviews.Content: I have hosted a social group outing at the Econo Lodge Phoenix for 4 years. Folks come in from all over the country. Hosting a varied group of people can be difficult when you consider all the different personalities. I am simply amazed that there has NEVER been a complaint about the motel from any who have been part of the group. We were so lucky to find the Econo Lodge Phoenix . I personally have relocated to another city but I chose to return to this location for our annual event based on the friendly, professional and accomodating manner of the manager Rick and his entire staff. They simply aim to please and they do a tremendous job of that.

Reviews.Title: “Good nights rest”
Reviews.Author: Iheartny_82
Reviews.Content: This motel is comfortable. Continental breakfast was great. It is not the Econo lodge anymore. The sign reads under new management. The pillows are extremely fluffy, I did get a good nights sleep. Area is safe. I did not appreciate the sign outside being cheaper than what I was actually charged, but after a long drive, who cares? Its right down the street from the 10 freeway so no traffic on the way out. I'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “western experience”
Reviews.Author: igodditt
Reviews.Content: This motel was very clean and comfrotable. What sets it apart is ithe employees I has the good fortune to come into contact with. We arrived on Oct. 10,2011 and the clerk on duty was so helpful in arranging our transportation to and from the airport and the rental car center. I was really impressed with their professional aproach. We were treated like family and I so appreciated the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Close to PHX airport and excellent staff...”
Reviews.Author: Scottie_143
Reviews.Content: I had flown into Phoenix without making reservations, and I had to call from the airport, but the staff was very helpful in getting me a room and also giving me the right directions in order to take the shuttle to and from the hotel and airport. I stayed for 3 nights, and my room was always clean and quiet. Breakfast was good, but after two days of bagels and coffee, I wanted hot breakfast, but the front desk guy referred me to this breakfast place called Over Easy, and breakfast there was amazing. I would recommend this hotel to everyone who want to stay close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean, affordable.”
Reviews.Author: aprui
Reviews.Content: We needed an affordable, clean place to stay close to the airport. This Econolodge was just right. A free shuttle picked us up at the airport an dropped us off at the hotel. The staff was very friendly. The rooms were neat and clean. Our room and the one next to us had a hairdryer. The free breakfast was simple but did the trick (I had a bagel with cream cheese, coffee, and juice). The area around the Phoenix airport is a bit rough, but it's like that in many cities and it didn't bother me. I did not feel unsafe for a moment. I woud recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here if I were you.”
Reviews.Author: lrsmiley
Reviews.Content: Bathtub and toilet were dirty and covered in hair. I asked to change rooms and the second room wasn't any better. The front desk's response...."we clean our rooms someone must have been in there since." Hmm....I think we have a bigger problem then if someone else has a key.

Reviews.Title: “We came back...and will be back...”
Reviews.Author: Howard B
Reviews.Content: I am a retired lawyer from Vancouver. My wife and I sailed to Mexico and were returning home to escape the summer heat. We took a bus to Phoenix. I asked a cab driver to find us a good but inexpensive motel near the airport. We were happy with the room and rate. We flew out the next morning using the the free shuttle. We were happy to return 2 months later heading back to our boat with lots of heavy and bulky boat stuff. We were returning on the same Mexican bus and of course there was no shuttle. The desk manager went out of her way to find us a suitable cab but had modest cooperation from several cab companies. Rick, a manager with a great personality and very generous attitude, drove us with our stuff in his own van the equivalent of a $40 cab ride. He helped load and unload. No charge. I have never received this treatment in any 5 star hotel...thus the 5 star rating. Howard and Lynn Bradbrooke Sailing Vessel Swift Current...presently in San Carlos Mexico...heading to Panama

Reviews.Title: “Find a Different Spot”
Reviews.Author: M-F_Trackers
Reviews.Content: Not knowing when we would be getting back into Phoenix after 13 days on the road we decided not to book a hotel ahead of time. What a mistake. Now we needed a place to stay for one night that was close to airport and it is getting late. What a mistake. Roaches, moldy shower curtain, clogged shower drain, Could not check-in to the airlines from the computer. Breakfast was a fair. They Tried to bill me for the use of the safe. DO NOT STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm really? Cesspool.”
Reviews.Author: Nomadity
Reviews.Content: Beware this place is in the seediest part of town. Even though it was close to the airport there was no amenities except a gas station nearby. Felt frightened to leave my room (never felt so unsafe before...in Asia, Europe, Australia etc.) Do yourself a favor pay an extra $15 and stay in Tempe.

Reviews.Title: “Rocking! [as in shaking]”
Reviews.Author: olenenok
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, large rooms, free internet, all the basics. Beware: no coffee pot, no snack dispensers, pool really should not be there, its super small, close to the office and street -- so is useless more or less. It is so close to airport that the room is really shaking every 10-20 minutes when flights land, i presume. If you are very tired, its good for its money. If you you want a little bit more relaxing place (where you might find pleasant to pop outside, to linger in bed, to have a little snack with a coffee or tea after a long day) -- this might not be it!

Reviews.Title: “An ok spot with a couple of hitches”
Reviews.Author: Mlfricke52
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on an overnight connection to Mexico arriving late and leaving early. The room was fine, clean, bed quite firm and location good only a couple of miles from the airport. Two hitches... 1) the shuttle from the airport is shared with a nearby parking lot so the trip over took 2 to 3 times longer than if direct, and 2) the low price quote you see on the web when making your reservation is for a SMOKING room and you must pay $15 more to upgrade to a non-smoking room.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: graingern
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after flying in late to Phoenix and were collecting our rental car the next day. It was ideal. Close to the airport, free shuttle service to and from the airport. Clean, big rooms, free breakfast, free internet and printing service. Very quiet hotel. Nice friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: OregonCountry
Reviews.Content: It is difficult to find hotels with airport shuttle service, that are reasonably priced. The Econolodge fit the bill. The rooms are clean and comfortable. For under $80, it was the best value we found. If you don't need a shuttle, there are other cheaper options. But we needed a ride to the airport. The only thing I noticed that might be a negative for some people is that there are no refridgerator or microwave in the room. There is a nice swimming pool, and average continental breakfast. There is no where to eat within walking distance. You can take the #3 bus Westbound, and there are some restaurants downtown (about 20 minutes), or there is a Jack in the box (about 5-10 minutes). You can also order out pizza.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive room with good shuttle service to airport”
Reviews.Author: unicabaker
Reviews.Content: This is a bare bones room, staff were pleasant, room clean. I don't eat continental breakfast, so I bought some fruit and yogurt at a nearby grocery. I stashed it in my ice bucket. Beware there was no hair dryer. It doesn't look like the best area, but I left my car there for seven nights with no problem. The shuttle leaves every hour from the hotel, and when I called their number from the airport they were there within ten minutes. Just remember what the shuttle looks like because it does not say Econolodge. I kept looking for Econolodge! The driver was kind enough to come looking for me. Overall good value and a safe place to stash my vehicle for the week, for just a few bucks more than long term parking. Plus I believe they told me I could leave my car for 21 days, with no additional charge.

Reviews.Title: ““Cozy, friendly place for the value seeking traveler.”
Reviews.Author: LOIS3959976
Reviews.Content: I always do my homework before I travel. I probably spend too much time. This place is clean. They have updated the place, so it is acceptable. The young staff is very accommodating. The breakfast is minimal, but it is free. If you are a picky eater, you may not be pleased, but for the rating and price, I think this is a great value. They had iron and ironing boards. They have coined washer/dryer available. Nice for this price!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute bargain basement accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: adg87
Reviews.Content: I don't know if it's fair to disparage a hotel that's $40.00 a night, but even at cheap prices, one has a right to expect some level of decent accomodations. The rooms were fairly large, but depressingly drab. They reeked of smoke, and the curtains were worn. The "security" of the door (an electronic key) was utterly useless as it seemed to be as easy as cake for someone who knows what they're doing to gain access to your room. The "linens" were a joke. Is it too much to ask to get washclothes that don't have holes in them? And the sheets looked like they had been in use since the 80's. There were hairs on my pillowcase, and burnmarks on the bedspread. I actually never got under the covers either night, and slept in my clothes. Two of the TV channels (cable) had no sound at all. The area is depressing, with only a Jack N' The Box and a seafood place available for those brave enough to walk around the corner. I booked a stay there to attend a Cardinals game, so I knew going in it wouldn't be great. I just thought someone might care enough to provide the basics to anyone desperate enough to stay there. I will say that the front office attendant was extremely nice and helpful, and answered all of my questions with a smile. And there was a coffee maker in my room along with a hairdryer. Neither of which I used. Otherwise nearly any other motel in that area would probably be a nicer stay. (Or maybe not. LOL!)

Reviews.Title: “Great motel, close to airport--location a little scary”
Reviews.Author: economom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently due to a family emergency. The location near the airport is not in one of the better neighborhoods in Phoenix, however, once we drove onto the property, we felt very safe and comfortable. There is a fence around the property, with a single entrance to drive through. The staff was great, and there is a computer with Internet access in the lobby. There is easy access to the Interstate also--just get your bearings before dark. They have a park and fly program, and although we didn't use it, I would have felt comfortable leaving my car there.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, good rate, iffy area”
Reviews.Author: pkitty
Reviews.Content: As I drove up to the Econo Lodge, I was a little jittery - the area did not look like the safest area, and I was a solo female traveler. I was glad I got there during daylight hours. The hotel itself was okay. The room was huge and generally decent. There were a few spots of something sticky on the toilet seat, despite the "Sanitized for Your Protection" wrapper; it wasn't a huge deal to wash it off myself so I did and let management know about it when I checked out. The website for the hotel is misleading as it states that there are "coffee makers in room." There aren't. There aren't blowdryers in the room either. I was in too much of a hurry in the morning, when I discovered this, to call to the front desk, but did mention it at checkout, when I was told that the coffeemakers had been removed from the rooms, and that blowdryers were available at the front desk. Would have been nice to have been tld that when I checked in! Despite being close to the airport and in a questionable looking area, the room was fairly quiet and I was able to get a good night's sleep before the very short (5-7 min) drive to the airport in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Priced, but comfortable motel not far from Sky Harbor airport”
Reviews.Author: maestrolms
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on two occasions, in March 2009 and March 2010, when I have gone to Phoenix for Cleveland Indians Spring Training games. The rooms are average-sized, with comfortable beds, there is a free shuttle to and from the airport, and it is only about ten minutes from the rental car facilities. It also offers a free continental breakfast. Management is very friendly and helpful. Less than a ten-minute drive to downtown and less than five to I-10. I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful for airport stay”
Reviews.Author: floggymog
Reviews.Content: We cannot say enough about this place. We only stayed one night (our flight left in the a.m.) and were delighted with the clean room and friendly service. We had a nice breakfast before we were shuttled to the airport. (left our vehicle there for 10 days.) On our return we called the motel and within 10 minutes the shuttle was there to pick us up and bring us directly to our vehicle. We actually stopped in to thank them for such a wonderful stay and easy access to and from the airport. This place is definately on our plans for next year. The price is very right!!!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kwaitang
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not in a good location, accosted for money by down and outs just going to local shop. But the room we had was very nice and clean. Shuttle to and from hotel and airport good. The night manager was lovely and very helpful. Would stay again but not go to shops at night. Very cheap to stay here so can't complain about value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Functional Accommodation, No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaOutdoorsDiva
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for what it is: clean, comfortable accommodation about two minutes from the airport. The room was big and clean and the bed comfortable. It's an excellent value for the price and you can't beat it for easy access to the airport. Front desk staff was extremely helpful and recommended a Mexican grocer to us a few blocks away for an AUTHENTIC Mexican dining experience. (Yeah, that's the way I roll. I want to know where the locals are eating). The neighborhood was fine and I felt completely safe at the hotel. Maybe if you're not used to "urban" areas, you might it a bit of a "shock", but it's completely fine. Only thing the room lacked was a blow dryer.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, bad location”
Reviews.Author: diamond_6irl
Reviews.Content: I stayed there just for a day since i went to Phx for the NBA ALL STAR GAME. This hotel looks more like a motel or condo because you can park your car infront of your room. The host there were very friendly and had brochures with useful info. The room was big and comfortable. Everything was clean, the bed, the bathroom and the tube and believe me, im picky. I really went there kind of scared because i read bad things about this hotel but specially because had no option since everything was full and some other hotels were overpriced because of the game, but when i opened my room's door i felt i made the right decision to make a reservation there besides i thought it was for one night only. They had free shuttle service, wi-fi and continental breakfast which was really poor but at least gives you the chance to eat something at early morning while you get ready to go out and eat real food. It says on their site that is really close to the airport but is not. At least it didnt seem to me. So you better take the shuttle service. They have courtesy phones at Sky Harbor (airport) so you call them to pick you up. The tricky thing is that nobody tells you that Van Buren st. is well known as a prostitute and drug dealer street. 3 cab drivers told me so. They said that was time ago, now is clean but still has the good fame. You can hardly find people walking there and very few cars. Some blocks looked scary and shady and some others depresing. If you dont bring your car and plan to visit downtown call a cab before leaving your room. You wont find a cab easily there and will have to walk making it unsafe for you. The distances in Phx are huge. Very long streets. Therefore, I strongly suggest you either bring your own car or get a cab. You can always use the train but anyway you would need to take a cab so they take you to the nearest station. It will cost you 17 bucks one way to downtown. Cab drivers are very friendly. Once in downtown you can easily find a cab to take you back to the hotel, cabs are all over the place specially near hotels. My recomendation is to avoid long walking distances if you are a solo traveler and of course get a better hotel with a better location if possible. If not just follow these steps and you'll be fine. The hotel is ok and the rooms are good considering is a 2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean !”
Reviews.Author: SUPERGSA
Reviews.Content: We were very happy to learn that the hotel offered free shuttle service. The hotel itself was clean, comfortable, almost pampering. The service was excellent. Every question we asked was answered right away. We would recommend this hotel to others as well as keep it in mind for future stays ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading information”
Reviews.Author: Petompkins
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for free airport shuttle service, but found out there is a charge for parking that was never mentioned on website. Ended up paying double for reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: BethanyinDallas
Reviews.Content: I'm a pretty positive person, and not too high-maintenance or picky. This is the first negative review I've ever posted here, but this hotel in Phoenix was heinous, awful, and horrendous. I'm seriously going to write a letter of complaint to the corporate office. -When we first went into the room, the A/C was off. It was about midnight, at least 100+ inside the room, and all we wanted to do was sleep. Miserable!! -The heavy "marble" facade on the front of the bathroom vanity had come unglued, and was hanging by a thread of caulk. I had to yank it down and put it on the floor so that it wouldn't fall off on our feet while we standing in front of the sink. -We stayed there three nights, and NOT ONCE did housekeeping clean our room! We ran out of towels, ran out of TOILET PAPER (!!!), and the two tiny trash bins were overflowing. This was after we both called and went in person to the front desk to complain. -We had to get our room cards re-programmed every single day. Every day. -After spending the night, the next day we drove down the street and realized there was a prison a couple of blocks away. The only good thing about that place was that it was cheap and close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Talk about saving money”
Reviews.Author: lajimatgr
Reviews.Content: If you want to really save money in Phoenix given the very high prices of hotels in this city, try this local hotel on the west side of the city. The hotel was packed the night we arrived but given our plane did not land until 1am and we did not get to the hotel until 2am, the wait staff was there with our reservation in hand. Luckily we found the hotel which was located in a less than desirable part of the city off a main highway but within easy access. The fellow at the counter was cordial and the room was sufficient even if the pillows were very old and pillow cases dirty. The bed had not been replaced in some time and the tv cable was limited but for a quick inexpesive stopover, it was a good solution. Try this place if you arrive late and just want a hot shower and a place to rest your hat.

Reviews.Title: “Shady neighborhood -- Never again!”
Reviews.Author: athena689
Reviews.Content: I booked this on Travelocity as a cheap place to stay before a 6AM flight. We pulled into the Econo Lodge off of VanBuren St. We thought the neighborhood was bad on our way in... only to find 2 scroungy guys in a fist fight in the parking lot. Never checked in... took the loss of the non refundable charge and stayed somewhere else. Wouldn't have slept a wink there regardless!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place :)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice management and very friendly. Proud to go again. Nice meal, nice rooms, nice everything!!! where can you get a better place like this:)

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 3037 Van Buren Street..........Upon walking into hotel room I found it to be quite simple and appeared neat and clean. However, prior to going to bed, I like to check my bed before I sleep, I found a strand of hairs under the pillow. That grossed me out.....just thinking that the bedding may not have been changed. What I did was took and brushed off with a pillow the hairs.....and went to sleep (I just stayed on one side of the bed (king size bed). Before leaving I decided to strip back all of the bedding and found what appeared to be pubic hair and stains on the sheet as well as the blanket. It was discussting. I even took pictures and called corporate they didn't seem to care.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: lflint
Reviews.Content: This Econo Lodge has better than average rooms and an air conditioner that easily keeps up with sweltering Phoenix heat. The reception building is spacious and breakfast is very basic. These are basic but clean accomodations close to downtown but in a slightly seedy neighborhood. If you're looking for inexpensive and don't need any frills then this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Never again...Econo Lodge Phoenix on Van Buren”
Reviews.Author: SB-JB1983
Reviews.Content: Extremely disappointed in this hotel. I guess one gets what they pay for...bugs and all for $40.00/night. One was crawling on the carpet when we walked in, and we later found 3 more on 3 separate towels. Considering Phoenix hit a record high temp of 115 on our arrival date, one would expect the air conditioning would have been turned on prior to our check in as advance reservations were made. We arrived about 9:00 p.m. to a room nearly as hot inside as it was outside. A call to the front desk inquiring about a fan resulted in no fan, but someone from the desk would come to our room to check out the cooling. The response time was prompt, but we were told, "It's going to take time to cool off. It is 110 degrees outside." It finally cooled off about 3:00 a.m., and needless to say we never even crawled into the beds, but rather slept on top of the one bed closest to the air. Check-out was quick and smooth...a good thing because we couldn't wait to get out of there. Never again.

HotelInfo.Name: Econo Lodge Phoenix
HotelInfo.Address: 3037 East Van Buren St, Phoenix, AZ 85008
